description: From Hindi सूबेदार (sūbedār)/Urdu صوبدار‎ (sūbadār), and its source, (Indian) Persian صوبدار‎ (subadâr), corresponding to subah +‎ -dar.

entries.meaning: (South Asia, historical) The governor or commander in charge of a subah; a viceroy. [from 17th c.]
(historical) An Indian officer in the British Indian Army, of a rank equivalent to captain. [from 18th c.]
examples: Also in his favour were his family's connections, the most notable of which consisted of an uncle who had risen to the rank of subedar in the East India Company's army  […]

entries.meaning: (India, Pakistan, Nepal) A noncommissioned officer rank in the armies of India and Pakistan.
